revised_title: Photographic Values of Moonlight and Starlight Compared with Candle Light
tldr: The author compared the photographic values of moonlight and starlight with the light of a standard candle. They used a scale of graduated opacity to measure the intensities of light and found that moonlight was 4.95 times less photographically bright than candle light. This research helped establish a better understanding of the photographic values of different light sources.
